Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mp_mastoparan (MP, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA; UCLL1c;Derivatives)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 65 uM) and B. subtilis (MIC 9 uM). Also active against S. aureus (more potent than against B. subtilis) and P. aeruginosa (MIC 50-150 uM). The lower the CFU, the lower the MIC.Structure:  The peptide adopts a helical conformation in 30% TFE or higher concentrations of SDS.toxicity: not hemo.lytic HC50=100 uM. human RBC: HC50 110.6 uM; rat RBC: HC50 123.6 uM. Less hemo.lytic (Ye et al., 2023).Updated 10/30/2010; Jan2017; 7/2021; 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Cerovský V, Slaninová J, Fucík V, Hulacová H, Borovicková L, Jezek R, Bednárová L2008
Literature Information.Title: New potent antimicrobial peptides from the venom of Polistinae wasps and their analogs
